com.gocardless.resources

Class Role

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gocardless.resources.Role

  • public class Role
extends Object

    Represents a role resource returned from the API.

    Roles represent a set of permissions that may be granted to a user. The permissions are specified at the resource-type level, and can be full_access or read_only. If a resource-type is not included that role’s users will have no access to resources of that type, and will receive an insufficient_permissions error when trying to use those endpoints.

    A role’s permissions attribute is used to set/show the permissions for a role and it’s key/value pairs are restricted to the below:

    resource

    One of:

    • customers
    • customer_bank_accounts
    • mandates
    • payments
    • payouts
    • creditors
    • creditor_bank_accounts
    • roles
    • users
    • events
    • api_keys
    • subscriptions
    • redirect_flows

    access

    One of:

    • full_access: read and write all records of this type
    • read_only: list and show endpoints available, but not create, update, delete, or actions

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Unique identifier, beginning with “RO”
      String getName()
      Human-readable name for the role.
      List<Role.Permissions> getPermissions()

    • Method Detail

      • getCreatedAt

        public String getCreatedAt()

        Fixed timestamp, recording when this resource was created.

      • getEnabled

        public Boolean getEnabled()

        Boolean value showing whether the role is enabled or disabled.

      • getId

        public String getId()

        Unique identifier, beginning with “RO”

      • getName

        public String getName()

        Human-readable name for the role.

      • getPermissions

        public List<Role.Permissions> getPermissions()

        An array of key-value pairs that define the permissions the role has. Each element of the array contains the following keys:

        • resource: the relevant, pluralised API resource, e.g. customers
        • access: the access level. One of full_access or read_only
